overview.title: Radio Group Component
overview.description: Radio buttons let users select exactly one option from a list of mutually exclusive choices.

html.title: HTML
html.code:
<fieldset class="radio-group">
  <legend>Plan</legend>
  <label><input type="radio" name="plan" value="basic"> Basic</label>
  <label><input type="radio" name="plan" value="pro"> Pro</label>
</fieldset>

css.title: CSS

js.title: JavaScript
js.description: JavaScript can listen for change events and update the selected value in the application state.

best-practices.title: Best Practices
points: All radios in a group must share the same name attribute.
Wrap related radios in a fieldset with a legend for context.
Ensure sufficient contrast for selected and focus states.
Make the entire label clickable by associating label and input.
Do not use radios when multiple selections are allowed; use checkboxes.
